data.title: Food Safety
data.meta_description: Fairfax County, Virginia - Food handling safety risks are more common than most people think. Each year, about 1 in 6 Americans (or 48 million people) gets sick, 128,000 are hospitalized and 3,000 die from foodborne diseases
data.text:
Boar's Head Provisions Co. Expands Recall for Ready-To-Eat Meat and Poultry Products Due to Possible Listeria Contamination. This expansion includes 71 products produced between May 10, 2024, and July 29, 2024, under the Boar’s Head and Old Country brand names. These items include meat intended for slicing at retail delis as well as some packaged meat and poultry products sold at retail locations. These products have “sell by” dates ranging from 29-JUL-2024 through 17-OCT-24. View full product list. View labels.

The CDC Food Safety Alert, Listeria Outbreak Linked to Meats Sliced at Delis, will continue to be updated with the latest investigation details.

See more information from the Virginia Department of Health.

See our update: Multistate Listeria Outbreak Linked to Meats Sliced at Delis.

Recall of Whole Cucumbers Because of Possible Health Risk

Fresh Start Produce Sales Inc. of Delray, Florida, is recalling whole cucumbers due to the potential to be contaminated with Salmonella. The recalled cucumbers were shipped in bulk cartons from May 17th through May 21st, 2024, directly to retail distribution centers, wholesalers, and food service distributors in several states including Virginia, West Virginia, and Maryland. Salmonella is an organism that can cause serious and sometimes fatal infections in young children, frail or elderly people, and others with weakened immune systems.

See detailed announcement and actions.

Past Alerts:

On March 6, the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) released an alert for six cinnamon brands sold in the U.S. that have been found to contain elevated levels of lead. See a list of products included in this alert on the FDA website.
